comment.author: 38118807@N07
comment._content:
Frank Gould was a philanthropist and the son of financier Jay Gould.  Frank Jay was the owner of a string of French Riviera casinos and hotels, which he leased to a French syndicate.  On December 1, 1901 he married Ethel Kelly and had two children.  They divorced in 1908. The Wichita Daily Times, Wichita Falls, Texas, wrote: "Frank Jay Gould and his wife who was Ethel Kelly have separated and it is said Mrs. Gould has brought action looking for a legal separation. Jealousy on the part of Mr. Gould, due, it is said, to the homage paid Mrs. Gould, who is a beautiful woman, by other men."

I really like this picture because the guys in that time all dressed similarly; None of the guys stand out, yet the women stand out because of their nice furs.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started a biography of him for Wikipedia in 2005: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Jay_Gould
